title: This ‘climate-friendly’ fuel comes with an astronomical cancer risk - The Guardian
summary: The EPA approved the creation of fuel from discarded plastics, despite the fact that the production of one of the fuels could emit air pollution that is so toxic, one out of four people exposed to it over a lifetime could get cancer.   The risk is 250,000 times greater than the level usually considered acceptable by the EPA division that approves new chemicals and the cancer burden will disproportionately fall on people who have low incomes and are Black.   Environmentalists say such claims are just greenwashing.
